summary: This is an email chain from December 2020 between US Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and an NYPD/FBI Task Force detective regarding outstanding investigative items for the Ghislaine Maxwell (GM) case. It discusses the status of FBI 302s, interview notes, forensic video file recovery from Epstein's devices, and arranging an interview with a witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM' and 'Maxwell'; the subject of the investigation and pending trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of searches of his devices for highly confidential items (images/videos).

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, following up on outstanding items for the Maxwell case from the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The signatory of the initial follow-up email, requesting status updates on investigative items from the FBI/Detective.

connections.description: Maxwell is under investigation for activities related to Epstein; the investigation involves searching Epstein's devices for evidence relevant to the Maxwell case.
The AUSA is requesting status updates from the Detective regarding forensic evidence and witness interviews for the Maxwell prosecution.
The AUSA is part of the team prosecuting Maxwell, as indicated by the reference to the case 'going to trial'.

events.title: Indirect contact with witness
events.description: Law enforcement made indirect contact with a witness who is aware she needs to be spoken to about the case going to trial. She agreed to call after the new year to schedule an interview.

events.title: Ongoing evidence processing
events.description: FBI 302 reports are still in process, with completion expected by next week or in the new year. FBI CART is processing video files from seized materials, expected to be completed in the new year.

keyFacts: Investigators were processing 'highly confidential items' (images/videos) identified during searches of Jeffrey Epstein's devices for the Maxwell case.
A key witness was contacted in December 2020 and agreed to schedule an interview after the new year regarding the Maxwell case 'going to trial'.
FBI Computer Analysis Response Team (CART) was attempting to recover playable video files from materials seized in the investigation.
The email chain shows active coordination between the US Attorney's Office and the NYPD/FBI Task Force in late 2020 to prepare evidence for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
Multiple individuals' names and email addresses are redacted in the document, indicating protected identities of law enforcement personnel and potentially witnesses.
